descriptions:
The response does not provide a correct explanation.

  • The moles of C 5 H 10 NH 2 + MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4079@ increase because the addition of the strong acid increases [ H 3 O + ] MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E2A@ , which results in Q<K MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGrbaccaGae8hpaWJaam4saaaa@3BA8@ , and the reaction proceeds to form more products as it re-establishes equilibrium.

title: Part F(i)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not provide the correct explanation.

  • Having more particles of gas means the reactants have a greater number of microstates and are more dispersed than the products. The reaction proceeding to a less dispersed arrangement would result in a decrease in entropy.

The response provides the correct explanation.

  • Having more particles of gas means the reactants have a greater number of microstates and are more dispersed than the products. The reaction proceeding to a less dispersed arrangement would result in a decrease in entropy.

title: Part F(ii)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
